brown.tracingplane

Class Baggage

  • java.lang.Object
    • brown.tracingplane.Baggage

  • public class Baggage
extends java.lang.Object

    The static methods in the Baggage class are the main entry point for manipulating BaggageContext instances. The methods here mirror those provided by the BaggageProvider interface.

    Use of the Baggage API depends on a BaggageProvider being configured. Typically, this is done automatically by the Tracing Plane distribution that you use. However, if this is not the case, or if you wish to override the BaggageProvider implementation in use, then set the baggage.provider property to the BaggageProviderFactory of your choice.

    • Method Detail

      • newInstance

        public static BaggageContext newInstance()
        Returns:
        a new instance of B, which may be null to indicate an empty baggage

      • discard

        public static void discard(BaggageContext baggage)
        Discards baggage, indicating that the instance will not be used again. This method is useful, but not required. Its purpose is to enable BaggageContext implementations to do things like reference counting, which is an optimization. Failing to discard baggage instances will have no bad side effects.
        Parameters:
        baggage - a baggage context

      • branch

        public static BaggageContext branch(BaggageContext from)
        Create and return a branched copy from. Typically, this will just duplicate from or increment a reference count. Sometimes it will create a new instance, or even modify the contents of from.
        Parameters:
        from - a baggage instance, possibly null
        Returns:
        a baggage instance branched from from, possibly null

      • join

        public static BaggageContext join(BaggageContext left,
                                  BaggageContext right)
        Merge the contents of left and right and return as baggage. left and right should be treated as discarded (or reused) after this method call.
        Parameters:
        left - a baggage instance, possibly null
        right - a baggage instance, possibly null
        Returns:
        a baggage instance with merged contents from left and right

      • deserialize

        public static BaggageContext deserialize(byte[] serialized)
        Deserialize the provided serialized baggage representation.
        Parameters:
        serialized - a serialized baggage
        Returns:
        a deserialized baggage instance, possibly null

      • deserialize

        public static BaggageContext deserialize(byte[] serialized,
                                         int offset,
                                         int length)
        Deserialize the provided serialized baggage representation.
        Parameters:
        serialized - a serialized baggage
        offset - offset into the array where the baggage bytes begin
        length - lenft of the baggage bytes
        Returns:
        a deserialized baggage instance, possibly null

      • deserialize

        public static BaggageContext deserialize(java.nio.ByteBuffer buf)
        Deserialize the provided serialized baggage representation.
        Parameters:
        buf - a serialized baggage
        Returns:
        a deserialized baggage instance, possibly null

      • serialize

        public static byte[] serialize(BaggageContext baggage)
        Serialize the provided baggage instance to its byte representation. This method should behave as though #branch(Baggage) is also being called prior to serialization.
        Parameters:
        baggage - a baggage instance to serialize, possibly null
        Returns:
        the serialized representation of baggage, which might be null or an empty byte array

      • serialize

        public static byte[] serialize(BaggageContext baggage,
                               int maximumSerializedSize)
        Serialize the provided baggage instance to its byte representation and trim the baggage so that its serialized size is <= maximumSerializedSize. This method should behave as though #branch(Baggage) is also being called prior to serialization.
        Parameters:
        baggage - a baggage instance to serialize, possibly null
        maximumSerializedSize - the maximum size in bytes of the serialized baggage.
        Returns:
        the serialized representation of baggage, which might be null or an empty byte array
